p: The upper Indus basin is located in the mountain ranges of the Hindu Kush, Karakoram, Himalaya and on the Tibetan Plateau. Seven different tributaries of the Indus drain from the UIB, covering a surface area of ∼425.000 km 2 ( Fig 1). The UIB covers an altitudinal range of ∼8500 m a.s.l., with a mean elevation of ∼3750 m a.s.l. Covering parts of Afghanistan, Pakistan, India and China makes the UIB a transboundary river basin in a geopolitically complex region. It is among the most glaciated areas on Earth, with ∼22.000 km 2 of glacier surface area [ 53].
